cyclone.name: FRANKLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 260 mi (420 km) south of Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north today, cross Hispaniola on Wednesday, then lift north-northeast into the western Atlantic east of the Bahamas—moving steadily away from the Virgin Islands area.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Dominican Republic north and east coast, Turks and Caicos Islands
weather_observation.warning_coast: Dominican Republic entire south coast and Haiti south coast from Anse d'Hainault eastward to the Dominican Republic border
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Hispaniola (both coasts), Turks and Caicos, eastern Bahamas
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤6%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusty squalls possible Wednesday–Thursday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for St. Croix; surge confined to Hispaniola landfall area.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could bring 1–3 inches of rain to St. Croix Wednesday into Thursday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and rip currents in nearby coastal waters during mid-week.
